rcW2Rg3yWxcDx2xP7p4NzA.text: Wings are not worth the price.  Cash only establishment (2014).  Service was slow, had to wait 30 min just for deep fried wings.... Wouldnt go back!!

RrjieDEF18Z8qi0uAR96Ag.text: I love these wings. Crisp on the outside and tender on the inside. Really great group of people serving you, too. They have an extensive selection of flavors for the more adventurous sort. If you like real wings you won't be disappointed!

J5ML80mY3CKipl2gswSlFg.text: Not a fan. I've gotten wings there twice and both times they were undercooked. Also, I live a pretty much cashless existence, so having to stop and get cash is an inconvenience. I never trust a cash only business; would love to review their books

8MD7l1NhtaUfbwsmY-TX-A.text: Took over 2 hours to deliver Luke warm wings then the delivery guy didn't have change so I was forced to give him extra. O and they forgot my 2 liter of pop.....

4nLgTJQ0mRbC0wQAKddHsg.text: Having relocated from the chicken wing capital of the world, Buffalo, NY, and never having an awesome wing in Western PA, I was a bit apprehensive about trying this place out. Boy was I wrong and glad that my friend brought me here. Super friendly guys working behind the counter that clearly have a passion for making people want their delicious, fresh wings. With over 120+ flavors, there's something for everyone.

rT8eMqB8UFr2KW4X2GXYIw.text: Love all the wings. Their wing dust is the BEST! I got the buffalo chicken salad last time. It was HUGE and loaded with tender, juicy chicken. Not to hot either. I ordered the buffalo chicken salad again a few days ago, still huge  but HOLY HELL it was HOT. WOW. I had to stop midway through and drink a glass of milk and eat a piece of bread. Next time I order I'm going to request to go a tad light on the buffalo sauce. Still a killer salad though! They don't skimp on the toppings or the meat.

J6dZn-b3Nlx2_XzcTOmnbQ.text: The fry cook can't count!  They sell 13 wings for $12.99.  I only got 12 with my order.  I told the manager who said something to the cook.  He told me that I was wrong.  The manager said sorry and that he would hook me up next time and he hoped that I would come back.  Fat chance.  Like I would try to get over on them for one wing.  I would have thought they would have just given me one more.  I felt that if I pushed it the cook would have put it between his butt cheeks before he dressed it so I let it go.  Needless to say I won't be back.  4 stars for the food and 0 stars for the management.

kg_DlYzgANtbltLq_iX1vA.text: Finally had the opportunity to stop here a few weeks ago. Since I had no idea what sauces to order, I wanted to make the takeout order in person. First, the staff at the Coraopolis location are nothing short of tremendous. I probably spent 15 minutes figuring out which wing sauces I would like and I needed their input. They let me taste around 10 different sauces. Therefore, I purchased a number of half dozen wings to get an good representation of the best they have to offer. 'Frank Sinatra', Steel City, 'Talk of Beaver Falls', 'Frankie Valli',and just plain hot. Everything was fantastic, The wings are cooked up crispy and the sauces are unlike anything I've ever had before. I also ordered the "Heart Attack' hoagie, a pizza, and the bacon ranch cheese tater tots. This place offers more than just wings and they execute everything at a very high level.   These are the best wings I have ever had in the Pittsburgh area and again, they have much more than just wings. I want to thank again the very patient and knowledgeable staff for all of their help. This is primarily a take out place but there are a number of tables/booths if you wish to eat there. I will be heading back soon even though the closest location is nearly an hour away.

DdvSZAxqi_ejCS46db0mow.text: Got this for delivery a couple weeks back, tried to order it again recently and the person who answered said they hadn't delivered to my area in years? I tried to explain but both the manager and the person on the phone were incredibly rude. Good food but the customer service ruined it for me.

SvjfBaYxQiOfPDuIcxVKyQ.text: Pittsburgh  mom and pop restaurant / dive place fan !  fits the real pittsburgh joint .  I love fresh cut fries, the bonus they put the wings on them. fried hard, like wings suds and spuds,but they have vast selection. it's worth  a try! you pay what you get for!

vCyFV6ctKvA2eTH63mCWWw.text: Great wings of all kinds.  Cooked well.  Service is great, salads are fresh.  Lots of food for the money.  Delivery team is frendly--and the delivery to 1/2 of Robinson Township!!!!!  Hoagies are good, although we've yet to try some of their more ambitious sandwiches.  Not health food by any stretch of the imagination, but if you are jones'in for a wing, this is the place.  Give it a try instead of pizza next time--you will enjoy.

uLdVCv58uvfKPlXHIjFPEA.text: It was alright, definitely not the best wings I've had. Great flavor options but the chicken just tasted oily and it was very dry.

fQi6AtSCF89xEGbqeQ93EA.text: Crisp wings and tender inside.  About 25 regular flavors and about 50 Signature flavors, some of which are a combination of regular flavors.  Really hard to decide what flavor to get so take a few friends so you an share and get to try different flavors.  Was able to have the Beaver Falls which is tangy and hot, was told it is one of the favorites, and I can see why.  Also, had the chance to try Jamaician Jerk which were OK, but not as good as I was expecting.  Will have to stop back and try some of the others.   Wings were 6 for $4.99 or 13 for $9.25, also had a 50 wings for approx $30 (I guess U better be hungry, lol).  Cash Only!!!!!!

JJXmA3L6IWdtKPsrzIZfuQ.text: I get this wings once in a while since I live a few blocks down the street. They are a little pricey but well worth the money. They are cooked crunchy and they have a ton of flavors to choose from, I personally recommend the frankie vallie. My wife always gets the butter garlic parmesan and we extremely recommend the cheese bacon fries where they use real bacon and not the fake bits.

kAcF81OSmMb2Tz4BouJY8g.text: Bigshot Bob's has tons of flavors and great crispy, meaty, wings.  Their fries are a fresh cut somewhere between a "potato patch" and a steak cut fry.  This isn't fast food wings they take each order and fry them individually, so don't expect to be in and out in five minutes if you're getting them to go. They also have some tables indoors if you want to stay there and eat   Quality takes time.  During that time you'll need to read over the menu and decide which of their many flavors you want to put on them. The people behind the counter will help you if you're lost in their list of flavors.   Don't forget this : they accept cash only! come with cash and  with an appetite.

Vya99hUoOwLOGJH_qXZH0g.text: Someone brought Big Shot Bob's wings to a bbq this past summer and they were delicious. I finally got out there and was very pleased. I will say that if you want take out, make sure you call ahead because they take about 20 minutes.   There are tons of flavors and we were pleased with all of them. Since this was my first time there, they let me try different sauces to see what I would like. Customer service always makes me happy!   I would definitely recommend this place to anyone. Wings are good, staff is friendly and you can always walk to a couple bars while you wait for your wings to be ready!

z7dv_Q9vsec8kWWYasScXQ.text: I ordered buffalo but they delivered BBQ, called they blamed customer.  Wings not too big, mediocre at best, drenched in sauce, never will call again.

adKauZsfyDF6STTCUxkuig.text: Big Shot Bob's is the place for wings! They have whatever flavor you're feeling on any given day. The Steel City flavor might be the best wing sauce this side of the mississippi! If you want wings, BSB's is the place to go.

OF6sF140R7VxPstNSx307g.text: Good sized wings, great sauces, people always friendly.  Talk of bever falls over a bed of fries is my go to favorite!!!!  Black N Gold is my second favorite.  Wings easily twice to three times the size of chain restaurants like BWW or Quaker.

D2HE1yrYHu0b7EsqSJWzgg.text: Great wings Bob... Wings of all flavors over 100 of them... Hoagies are just as good but the wings are to die for... I always pick up... Make sure you have cash, they don't take cards...

vlR0T8m1zluIR4HkicICiA.text: So glad my boyfriend chose this place for his birthday lunch! Loved everything the food was outstanding...best wings and Italian hoagie I've ever had! I also loved the homey atmosphere...both the owner and the cook were super friendly! Can't wait to go back

thLEbdakinipAdO5Jpc4mw.text: I ordered the talk of beaver falls, butter parm, big fine woman 2000 wings as seeing other yelp recommendation  and the bacon cheese fries with sour cream. The fries were terrible! The were over cooked in what looked like axle grease instead of cooking oil. If it was cooking oil it hadn't been changed in like Forever! The wings were OK not great But not bad. I wouldn't go back. Such a shame, I was really looking forward to this place with all the hipe over it. Maybe the one in Avalon is better.

xdtnO7_h9s3RQcuCjC0Vhg.text: This place has good wings, but they have serious issues...they have like 3-4 tables, that's it!  The soda/ice machine is out of order so you have to buy canned soda if you want it.  And the capper, cash only.  The kitchen looked dirty, and the oil thru cooked the wings on looked old.  Like I said, the wings were good, but the food only does not a restaurant only make.

photos.caption: Photo of Big Shot Bob's House of Wings - Coraopolis - Coraopolis, PA, United States
Photo of Big Shot Bob's House of Wings - Coraopolis - Coraopolis, PA, United States

I13HA5uUv--vP5wJuXF2MQ.text: Well hot damn we found ourselves Pittsburgh's best wings.  These are hands down the tastiest wings I've had in Pittsburgh. I got 6 "Talk of Beaver Falls" and 13 "WESTVIEW CONNECTION" (BSB's Wet Cajun Garlic with a Green Jalapeno Base). I'll say I was pretty upset i didn't get 13 of the Talk of Beaver Falls, holy elephant sh** were they delicious.  They carried a nice kick but not lip numbing a bit sweet, but smothered by a good heat and a peppercorn kick. I loved it and THAT was well worth the price.The Westview connection was alright. A bit on the dry salty side but great flavor and a good amount of spice.  The only thing holding this back from a solid 5 stars is the wing size and the price- They just don't line up.  Inexpensive wing--small--OK man Expensive wing--Big -- Cool Expensive wing-- Not big-- Not cool man  That's my formula. However, BSB's adds a variable making it: Expensive wing--not big--very tasty--Sure thing dude.  So I'm alright with it, it's well worth the price for the right flavor. I'd recommend getting a side of fries and lapping up the excess sauce, screw KFC - THIS is finger lick'n good.

_lQFsFww3WyKFMegF_tYbQ.text: This spot is pretty good! There flavors are really unique and there are a ton of different ones! I suggest that if you've never been here, to probably read the menu before you go. There is A LOT to choose from.   We got the bacon ranch dusted tater tots as an appetizer and the ranch dusting they put on them is amazing!!! We then got the Cool Runnings wings, Pigeon wings, Talk of Beaver Falls, and the Uncle Nick's wings. They were all very unique flavors and definitely like none I've ever had. The Talk of Beaver Falls was really spicy and so were the Uncle Nick's. But they were all super delicious!!  The people working there are funny and definitely brighten up the otherwise dull interior.   Best wings in Pittsburgh is pushing it, but they are definitely unique with there flavors. I give them a four star because the wings themselves were a little too done for me.

photos.caption: Photo of Big Shot Bob's House of Wings - Coraopolis - Coraopolis, PA, United States. Bacon Ranch Dusted Tater Tots with Melted Cheese On Top. So Good!!
Photo of Big Shot Bob's House of Wings - Coraopolis - Coraopolis, PA, United States

zcMx0lTgutxKHlRq_RQduQ.text: Cash only! Guess they don't like business folk in there. Ffs! I really wanted wings too....

0Qcp0o7R-QqQzXWcEx91Kw.text: My family and I have ordered wings here many times.  The "cash only" is annoying.  The prices are high but the wings are good.  None of those reasons have kept us away....  This evening was a different experience altogether and WE WILL NOT BE BACK.  My sister and I went to pick up an order...7:30 pm on a Friday...no big deal.  As we waited at the counter for our order, another customer walks in with his 13 yr old son.  The dad was obviously drunk and proceeded to harass us....sexually harass us!  We tried several times to avoid conversation, change topics...anything to diffuse the situation.  The two guys working seemed to find the situation amusing because they did nothing to intervene...felt it was appropriate to sit back and grin!  We felt very intimidated and threatened.  We won't be back...in good conscience I would not recommend this establishment. There are plenty of good wing places that can provide a safe and welcoming environment .

wlPZ_djftiV3LogF14Dppw.text: Big shot bobs comes very close to 5 stars. They have the best wing flavors in town! Being cash only and having high prices are their only downsides. The inside is small, but it works for a wing place. All of the employees that I've encountered have been helpful and nice!

pyVePAbrU2Fw-X3g7SR_XA.text: Here for work and decided to give it a try.  Lots of different wing options.  Cooked well and served hot!  Great service as well!  Give it a try!!

4CWwWHOEWQnAaH0CBmdmaw.text: solid food.  well prepared.  I was not real big on the flavors I ordered but that was my fault.  The wings were nice and tender.    Be aware that they do not accept credit cards.

mO5jOABlx7aCo3jq17Cgng.text: These wings are tremendous!   Big Shot Bob's is a hole-in-the-wall, mostly takeout place. There are a few tables, but it's not really a cozy place to eat. The guys at the counter were very friendly and there is a TV in there. However, these wings are incredible. I'd eat them in a box, with a fox, on a boat or with a goat.  First of all, you've got all kinds of flavor options. I had the Frank Sinatra which is covered in blue cheese, hot sauce, and parmesan cheese. I also had the Talk of Beaver Falls which was spicy and tangy in a unique way. My mouth is watering just thinking about it. My wife tried one that had sauce and garlic and it was fresh chopped garlic chunks! AWESOME.  You can add on a bed of fries under the wings and slathered in sauce. After doing this, I'd recommend just getting a side of fries separately. There is likely to be plenty of sauce to dip anyway, and this will give you an option for something to cool your mouth if you get a spicy flavor. The fries are fresh cut style and very good however you serve them.  Your best bet is to call in a pick up order, arrive early enough to pick them up as soon as they're ready, and head home to enjoy! You can't split flavors in an order, but it's amazing how filling six of these wings can be. For an average person, I'd suggest two orders of six and pick two flavors. There are more than 100 flavors, so if you do this every day it will take about two months to try them all!  I can't wait to be back in town to try more!

BY022ERed1WdJ2fFxaBwXA.text: Best wings ever.  Ordered in for takeout, and when we couldn't choose one of the 150 (!!!) flavors, we were offered to sample a bunch to see which ones we liked best. (super nice!) and given suggestions based on our preferences (medium spicy, not sweet/sugary)  Ended up going with (in order of amazing to only slightly less amazing)  Uncle Rico Pigeon Frank Sinatra Uncle Nicks.   As previously stated in other reviews, probably on the expensive side for the size of wings, but still...   Cash only.   I will absolutely be returning.

0KuPSchvPKEznbeeFzTiUg.text: Fantastic selection of wing flavors!!!  Priced fairly, good quick service.   As a special treat their ranch cheese bacon tots are a great side! Only downside is cash only, but they gave an arm on site

PLWDs306r9nRY5ZVG4c92A.text: Great wings- awesome sauces- nice guys. Super low key environment with awesome wings.  Pigeon wings, walk of beaver falls, Frankie valleys, and cool runnings are ALL f-ing great sauces. I love wings and the quality of the meat at Big Shot Bob's is top of the line. Meaty, juicy, crispy.   Atmosphere suits the place but isn't glitzy at all.   Skip the Quaker State, Wings Suds N Spuds na't. if your looking for top quality wings go to corao for Big Shot Bob's.  CASH ONLY.

jh4sG9uTxIP5G50Vx3EYlQ.text: Really tasty! My husband got the garlic Parmesan and a mushroom philly and I opted for the steel city. They have an incredibly large menu of flavor options which was cool. The only thing I wasn't crazy about was the price. About a dollar per wing seems a little steep. They delivered to our hotel, so it saved us from paying ridiculous hotel restaurant prices.

O93m7Eun-58VVUIQkqIwaQ.text: Love love love this place! Food is always amazing. People who work there are the best, they know my family because we come so often and they know our order. Everything I have tried has been amazing and it will always be my families first choice for takeout.

NamvqLXYFjLpGSLArB4lCA.text: Ridiculously good food.... not if you're in a hurry tho.  Everything is made fresh and comes to your door HOT.  Wings are awesome but my favorite menu item is the Philly cheese steak (the chicken Philly is also to die for)    The Philly is done perfectly!!  And if you are feeling particularly hungry, get the bacon cheese fries- a heart attack in a to go box.  Sooooo good!!!

U-PhKYGtiQfwe4gOwZ7f8Q.text: Love the flavor options, and the wings were decent. Best wings I've ever had? No. But they were solid. I got the Walk of Beaver Falls (spicier than the Talk of version) and I was impressed by how the heat builds as you keep eating them. As a spice addict, I was surprised how quickly I ran out of water while eating these wings.  The Boyfriend got wings with Bob's Signature Hot sauce on them, and his only complaint was that the sauce was a little too salty for his taste.  Tater tots were good as well, and you get a HUGE plate full of them.  Perhaps the best reason to come back, though, is the staff. They're thoughtful and funny, and they anticipate what you need before you even know you need it.

ao0hThwc4je4L6iroH7dKQ.text: Great wings. I order take out because I live right down the road. Not sure I would eat inside, just seems a little too divey for me.   Don't let that stop you from trying some of the best wings I've ever had. Lots of flavor combos and the bed of fries really makes it a great place.  If you like wings and haven't had this place you're really missing out.

oZkt8GqCinln2BDqFI1_5Q.text: Good wings with an assortment of different flavors.  Wings are crispy on the outside but tender and moist inside.   My go to sauce flavors are Napoleon, Napoleon dynamite, Napoleon Complex (napoleons are like sweet buffalo sauce plus some spice), pigeon wings, black and gold, black and yellow and bigfinewoman2000.  I've also tried their hoagies/sandwhiches and burgers and that too are good.  People that work there are always nice and helpful.  Great wings and service!  Just a note this place is cash only.

fQz_Kiabs66Y5WlzYenrQw.text: Great wings!!! I stopped into the area to get my tank washed out and I asked the worker about this place and was told it was awesome! So I called and ordered some wings and fries. I told the guy on the phone I was from New Orleans and I see they had a Louisiana flavor sauce. He told me it was good but my other option was a better choice "Black Magic." He was very helpful and his suggestion was on point cause the wings was kicking like Van Dam in the movie "Bloodsport". In other words whenever I'm in to this will be my must stop for some great food and cool people. I will advise anyone to go and try the many different flavor combination they have. Thanks for the great food see you'll next rip...."BABY"

photos.caption: Photo of Big Shot Bob's House of Wings - Coraopolis - Coraopolis, PA, United States

QhvEHMsnVFUiK4cbPfTDNA.text: Great selection of wing flavors and they're always crispy and delicious.  Friendly and courteous staff. If you haven't tried them yet you owe it to yourself to order some soon. Mr. C's are one of my favorites black magic Cajun seasoning covered in Parmesan cheese.

H-SiQEmtWH557aLkEiHUsQ.text: Great wings and very friendly people. Not often you find people that appreciate your business but this guys will take care of you even if you get there late. I surely appreciate the hospitality.

AsIHDjS2cYk_DaftN43QFg.text: I have only ever had delivery but loved it each time.  The wings are large and crispy. The sauces are great, tons of flavors both dry and wet. I prefer the more simple flavors as the wings have tons of sauce.  The fries are hand cut and delicious. The prices are really high. This is why I have 4 stars. I had 12 wings, a small fry and celery with blue cheese and it was $24

wUEHqlKG-MhcAI9IUvKjEA.text: Best wings in pittsburgh. Hands down. Pookie flavor is an always go-to. Service is always solid. Decent prices. Tons of flavors to choose from. The only wing place I will order from!

dLXcjpXAfdaZFEQuyr82iw.text: Yum.  I'm a wing junkie (as any buffalo girl should be) so I was excited to try someplace that boasts so many flavors!    The menu is actually a little overwhelming because there are so many variations.  But on closer inspection a lot of the flavors are just minor variations of others (just adding or changing one ingredient).  I ordered late on a Monday night (9:30) so I was surprised my order was going to take a half hour.  Apparently that is a standard wait time as I asked about it when I came to pick up my wings.  Not a big deal, but a longer wait time then a lot of similar pizza/wing places.  The wings were done perfectly and had a lot of sauce.  I was happy about this because a lot of places don't give you much.  The amount of extra sauce goes perfect with an order of fries (you can order them on the side or you can order your wings on a bed of fries).  The fries appear to be fresh cut and a pretty thick.  They had a great flavor and were cooked to perfection.    I rated this three stars because of the price that everything ends up being.  The wings were very tasty and they listen to specific directions well (I like my wings done extra crispy).  But wings are almost $7 for six of them and that doesn't include the blue cheese or celery (which are $1 each extra).  Other places that serve wings for comparable prices include the celery and blue cheese for that price.  On the plus side, at least they have celery and blue cheese as an option (because a lot of Pittsburgh restaurants don't).  A great choice for an order of wings.  Definitely someplace I'll try again.  I just wish the wings and celery were included in the price.

HcxvTG6GGOUhBodnqrGtuQ.text: A buddy of mine told me I had to try this place, but sadly, I was unimpressed. I tried six different flavors, and while they were all good, it was ruined by the fact that the wings themselves were over-fried, leaving them tough and chewy.

iKvHPdLUijRvezNX6lTS5A.text: *Mr Northside* So different and tasty. Honey mustard and bbq.. these are my second favorite next to Talk of beaver falls..   *Talk of beaver falls* I could eat these wings the rest of my life! They are so tangy and tasty !!  *Hunny Bunny* Have a thai flavor to them. Chilli Sauce and Ranch.. different but not down with the thai flavor wings.  *Game Changer*:  Interesting  .. if you are a lover of ranch try these.  I have gotten this flavor a few different ways. Sometimes there is a hint of ranch - sometimes they are swimming in ranch.  Its the same flavor but consistency of ingredients changes a little bit.  *Lemon Pepper*: zesty-- definitely good.  *Buffalo Parm*:  I have tried - medium parm and hot parm and just isn't one of my favorite flavors.  They are just "ok".  This flavor is not on the menu but I love the combination thought I would try.

photos.caption: Photo of Big Shot Bob's House of Wings - Coraopolis - Coraopolis, PA, United States. Jimmy Detillo Steak Sandwich.. interesting
Photo of Big Shot Bob's House of Wings - Coraopolis - Coraopolis, PA, United States. Mr Northside wings.. delicious interesting combo.. honey mustard and bbq

J50JCY8a2KJHkEWbDYstOg.text: Billy Joel once complained to his delicious chicken wings: "you had to be from Big Shot, didn't you." Driving 4 hours for wings seems insane when you live in Buffalo, but Bob's makes it almost worth it.  What to get: Wings (Old Bay - Wet)  These are simply the best wings I've ever had outside of Buffalo (the home of wings, and rightly so). In fact, were they in Buffalo, they'd be one of the best wing spots there too, believe it or not. They're not just the best in Pitt.. they're some of the best anywhere.  I highly recommend you get the Old Bay, Wet. Which means they are dripping in butter (shush, if you're eating wings you're not eating healthy anyway so get over it and let your heart worry about it), and seasoned to perfection with dark delicious maroon-crimson-reddish Old Bay seasoning. Every wing will rock your world, and you'll wish you had ordered more.  Speaking of which, I love that they'll make you just 5 wings (for 6 or so dollars) instead of making you order a full 10 (like most wing places in Buffalo do). If Old Bay isn't your thing, they have, ooh, about 50 other combinations for you to choose from. Take it from this connoisseur... these are some of the best wings you'll ever eat, and all three of their locations make them equally perfectly.  So when your friends say "where are the best wings in town?" and some fool offers up suggestions such as Hooters or BW3 (eww), then learn from that Richard Dreyfus movie and scream out "WHAT ABOUT BOB'S?"

photos.caption: Photo of Big Shot Bob's House of Wings - Coraopolis - Coraopolis, PA, United States. No no no no you had to be a beeg shot deednt you
Photo of Big Shot Bob's House of Wings - Coraopolis - Coraopolis, PA, United States. These wings.. old bay wet.. are the best I ever had outside buffalo. Wetter is always better.

f2zv-xvHB6q5HdR2P4DCKQ.text: Best wings ANYWHERE! You will not be disappointed...so many varieties and not just that but meaty, most tasteful wings you'll ever eat. Staff is friendly as well. I will my order wings anywhere else but from any of Bob's locations around Pittsburgh

J-qO7otekivcyj6otO9JJw.text: Best wings I've had so far.  Huge variety of different flavors of great quality wings.

_WDQa91RqL2QHHUS5DZ_sw.text: One of our favorite Friday night meals. This location has the BEST wings. We always call in our order for pickup as we are leaving the grocery store to be able to stop by to get the wings on our way home. Definitely make sure you call ahead since this establishment is cooked to order. Still worth the wait if not though.   My Favorites: Steel City  Pigeon Wings  His Favorites:  Eye of the Tiger Primetime

m_XYzDPnbmb7gB2xqM7Icw.text: Bob's in Cory has a very good variety of very good wings.  It's not the most atmospheric place, but that's not their strength.   If you are fiending for wings, it's still definite, but if you are looking for something else, then probably not.  Prices are average, and the service is friendly.

eoqHdhyhqBPkHokpNHQbMQ.text: Wings are ok.  They are bigger than Quaker steaks and lubes which is a plus.  Everything is made to order and takes time.  This is great.  The negatives are that the prices are fairly high for what you get in this area, they only take cash, and have a very expensive atm machine on premise.  As a business traveler this is unacceptable and as someone who hates carrying cash this is a burden.  Credit cards are not hard to accept and the fees are very low.  Accepting cash only anymore just means you are cutting corners and cooking the books.

dnmX4ACz7MqFFte7uJsFUQ.text: We're visiting from out of town and because of the weather we decided to order delivery. We came across Big Shot Bob's and gave it a try. When I called to place the order they sounded very unorganized. But the girl I talked to apologized because they were backed up. So, placed the order and they said it was a hour to a hour and a half wait for delievery. No big deal, they did deliver within the hour. I took our bag and noticed that two of our boxes were covered in plastic wrap because they were dripping sauce and it got everywhere. We also order ranch to go with our wings and there was no ranch. I called back (within 5 minutes of the driver leaving) to see if the driver was still in our area so he could turn around and bring them back. The next woman I talked to said the driver was already gone and it would take a hour and half to two hours to bring ranch. I told her we paid $1.50 for the ranch and she said we can credit your next order. I told her we're visiting and won't be ordering again. So not only did we not get our ranch, our fries were cold and looked like they were burned, and I gave the driver a $5.00 tip. The only reason I'm even giving a star partially because I can't leave a review without it and the other half is because the wings actually had a good flavor.

photos.caption: Photo of Big Shot Bob's House of Wings - Coraopolis - Coraopolis, PA, United States. More grease
Photo of Big Shot Bob's House of Wings - Coraopolis - Coraopolis, PA, United States. Cold fries
Photo of Big Shot Bob's House of Wings - Coraopolis - Coraopolis, PA, United States. Greasy mess

EPimCHQw8d2kQolIVTybLg.text: Garlic butter Pamesan wings way over cooked super dry and crunchy..... French fries most were black and way over cooked as well... Huge disappointment

photos.caption: Photo of Big Shot Bob's House of Wings - Coraopolis - Coraopolis, PA, United States
Photo of Big Shot Bob's House of Wings - Coraopolis - Coraopolis, PA, United States

ICjfXzgLv9mewoaI3_cQWw.text: A friend ordered wings for us from here as a gift for helping them move into their house. I didn't know what to expect. I looked at the menu and was a little flabbergasted from all the wing sauce choices.    Needless to say, these wings were on point. I tried the mr. North side sauce which was excellent. I'm sure it's not the healthiest meal, (as the wings sit on top of fries and are covered in your choice of sauce) but they were delicious. Perfect for the occasional indulgence.     Overall, I was very happy with my meal and had a great experience. It was takeout so I can't speculate on what it's like to dine in. Either way, we will try it again.

4IczE862Ik6ZjqA9kuEgoA.text: Ordered delivery tonight. Wings were about 20  minutes early and cooked perfectly. Way to go, BSB's.

E65OoTWpNTcqmmMqox9BTw.text: Stopped at Big Shot Bobs with my son tonight. It's a small eat in establishment on a corner lot. The parking lot is small, and can be difficult to maneuver if they're busy, or you drive a large vehicle.  The dining room was fairly clean.  Ordering is done at the counter.  Then menu was typical for a pizza / wing joint. They had a handful of run of the mill sandwiches, and standard pizza options.... But we were there for wings.  They had an impressive selection of wing sauces - all the normals, and as many 'in house' special sauces. The wings only come in quantities of 6, 13, and 50.  Want more than one sauce?? Have to buy 50 (or order in multiples of 6 or 13.). The wings are pricey, in my opinion... A 6 count will run you $6.49.  13, $12.99.  And 50, 46.99.    I ordered 13 of the 'Talk of Beaver Falls,' and my son got 13 mild buffalo.  I asked for two Fountain drinks, but the fountain was down.  We got an off brand orange soda. And a water.  They did tell us wings take approximately 20 minutes to make. We also ordered a large fry and sat down to wait.  The dining area has about 6 booths and 2 tables.  It's decor was dated, it had the 'greasy spoon' feel.  A roll of paper towels were the decoration placed on each tabletop.  There is one TV in the dining room, and it faces the counter.  It was turned up far too loud.  The fries came out first.  They're long and thick, fried and coated in a seasoned salt.  The portion was plenty for the both of us.  Before we could finish the fries, our wings came out.    They're served in a diner type basket, lined and wrapped in tin foil.  The wings weren't tossed in the sauce, but rather it was dumped on top of them. There was a ton of sauce in the basket, but you had to stir the wings around to fully coat them.  They were hot (temperature), and the sauce did not disappoint.  The wings were a little over done.... On the acceptable side of overdone.... A little too crispy.    The wings were a great size... They were individual pieces, but were far too large to call them wingdings.  My son and I ate, and I headed to settle up.  THIS IS A CASH ONLY ESTABLISHMENT.  They have an ATM in the building, but will not accept cards.    Our bill was $36.  We both left full, but it still seems a little steep.   I would go back again...   A five star rating if the wings weren't slightly over done, and they accepted cards.

niqJ4-_GgqU2dYVzvzLF9Q.text: I got a steak hoagie and the loaded fry with bacon the steak hoagie tastes ok it wasn't the best the bread fell apart and everything just fell off the hoagieit was hard to eat and sloppy the loaded fry was ok nothing special it was slab bacon and kinda hard to eat I wasn't from around that area just looked on Yelp to find something quick to eat for lunch while I was at work I probably wouldn't go back

MapKahiQlvv_bPIH0IOKcw.text: Bob's is always there with great food when I'm really in the mood to gorge myself a bit. I'm a simple winds guy, but my friends who are more experimental with their sauce tastes love the diverse menu.

KljvuDcvXH2imjly2i0Gmw.text: Had an intense craving for wings after work one night and checked on Yelp to see that Big Shot Bob's was the closest wing place with postive reviews.  Ordered the Talk of Beaver Falls (one of their bestsellers) and William Henry Harrison (jamaican jerk and parmesan cheese).    I thought the wings were crispy, fresh, tender and of decent size but I wasn't a huge fan of the flavors I chose.  The Talk of Beaver Falls tasted like your're traditional wings with Frank's Red Hot and the William Henry Harrison was greasier than I would have liked.  I mean I get it, wings are greasy but there wasn't much flavor on the William Henry Harrison wings because they seemed covered in oil and whatever seasoning that was used slipped right off.    Maybe I chose the wrong flavors but I wouldn't be opposed to trying them again.  I'm still a huge fan of the wings at Birmingham Bridge Tavern and they are my fave to date!
